# Health Literacy {#sec-health-literacy}

```{r}
#| label: setup-ch4
#| include: false

library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggpubr)
library(patchwork)
library(kableExtra)

# ---- Percentile Helper ----
add_percentile <- function(x) {
  pct <- round(percent_rank(x) * 100)
  label <- case_when(
    pct < 33.33 ~ "low",
    pct < 66.67 ~ "mid",
    TRUE ~ "high"
  )
  paste0(pct, "% (", label, ")")
}

# ---- Color Palette for Chapter 4 ----
colors_literacy <- "#2a9d8f"   # teal

# ---- Load & Prepare Data ----
alldata <- read_csv("data/survey_data.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)

alldata <- alldata %>%
  filter(
    !is.na(PASSWORD),
    PASSWORD != "PASSWORD",
    !grepl("ImportId", PASSWORD, fixed = TRUE),
    !grepl("ImportId", YEAR, fixed = TRUE),
    PASSWORD != "What is the current year?",
    YEAR != "What is the current year?"
  )

# Remove duplicate olive0925 (keep first occurrence, drop second)
olive_rows <- which(alldata$PASSWORD == "olive0925")
if (length(olive_rows) > 1) {
  alldata <- alldata[-olive_rows[-1], ]
}

# Clean passwords: replace identifying entries
alldata <- alldata %>%
  mutate(
    PASSWORD = case_when(
      PASSWORD == "Powerisgay2!" ~ "Power2",
      PASSWORD == "K1lc0yne$402" ~ "Health$402",
      PASSWORD == "Charlie1203" ~ "Health1203",
      PASSWORD == "aaron4103" ~ "health4103",
      PASSWORD == "brandonc1248" ~ "health1248",
      PASSWORD == "joyas1244" ~ "health1244",
      PASSWORD == "olive0925" ~ "health0925",
      TRUE ~ PASSWORD
    )
  )

alldata <- alldata %>%
  mutate(
    CLASS = factor(
      CLASS,
      levels = c("1", "2", "3"),
      labels = c("PH322", "ANTH206", "Peer Mentor / TA")
    )
  )
```

This chapter focuses on **health literacy** --- your ability to find, understand, evaluate, and use health information. Health literacy is a critical determinant of health communication effectiveness because it shapes how audiences engage with health messages, navigate health systems, and make informed decisions.

## Health Literacy Scale

### Constructs {.unnumbered}

The **Health Literacy Scale** ([Abel et al., 2015](appendix.qmd#sec-appendix)) measures your self-assessed ability to navigate health information. Health literacy encompasses the knowledge, motivation, and competencies needed to access, understand, appraise, and apply health information in everyday life.

### Measures {.unnumbered}

The scale contains 8 items rated on a 5-point scale: 1 = *Very Bad*, 2 = *Bad*, 3 = *Moderate*, 4 = *Good*, 5 = *Very Good*. Higher scores indicate higher self-reported health literacy. Participants who selected "I do not make use of this kind of information" are coded as missing.

**Example items:**

- *"How well do you understand instruction leaflets for medication?"*
- *"How well do you understand information brochures on health issues?"*
- *"When I have questions on diseases or complaints, I know where I can find information on these issues."*
- *"When I want to do something for my health without being sick, I know where I can find information on these issues."*
- *"How often were you able to help your family members or a friend if they had questions concerning health issues?"*
- *"When you came up with questions concerning health issues, how often were you able to get information and advice from others (family and friends)?"*
- *"How well are you doing in choosing the advices and offers that fit with you the most?"*
- *"Regarding information on health on the Internet, I'm able to determine which sources are of high and which of poor quality."*

```{r}
#| label: literacy-compute

literacy_data <- alldata %>%
  select(CLASS, PASSWORD, all_of(paste0("LITERACY_", 1:8))) %>%
  mutate(across(starts_with("LITERACY_"), ~ as.numeric(.)))

# Remove participants who selected "I do not make use of this kind of information" (coded as -50)
literacy_data <- literacy_data %>%
  mutate(across(
    starts_with("LITERACY_"),
    ~ ifelse(. < 0, NA, .)
  ))

literacy_data <- literacy_data %>%
  mutate(
    health_literacy = rowMeans(
      pick(all_of(paste0("LITERACY_", 1:8))), na.rm = TRUE
    )
  )
```

### Your Scores {.unnumbered}

Find your password below to see your Health Literacy composite score.

```{r}
#| label: literacy-password-table

literacy_password <- literacy_data %>%
  filter(!is.na(PASSWORD), PASSWORD != "") %>%
  mutate(health_literacy_pct = add_percentile(health_literacy)) %>%
  select(PASSWORD, health_literacy, health_literacy_pct) %>%
  arrange(PASSWORD)

literacy_password %>%
  kbl(
    digits = 2,
    escape = FALSE,
    col.names = c("Password",
                   paste0("<span style='color:", colors_literacy, "'>Health Literacy</span>"),
                   paste0("<span style='color:", colors_literacy, "'>Score (%)</span>")),
    caption = "Health Literacy Scale: Your Composite Score"
  ) %>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed"), full_width = FALSE)
```

### Class Distribution {.unnumbered}

```{r}
#| label: literacy-density
#| fig-cap: "Health Literacy Scale: Distribution of self-reported health literacy across all participants. Dashed lines indicate the 33rd and 67th percentiles."
#| fig-width: 8
#| fig-height: 5

q33_literacy <- quantile(literacy_data$health_literacy, probs = 1/3, na.rm = TRUE)
q67_literacy <- quantile(literacy_data$health_literacy, probs = 2/3, na.rm = TRUE)

ggdensity(
  literacy_data %>% filter(!is.na(health_literacy)),
  x = "health_literacy",
  fill = colors_literacy,
  color = colors_literacy,
  alpha = 0.4
) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = q33_literacy, linetype = "dashed", color = colors_literacy, linewidth = 0.6) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = q67_literacy, linetype = "dashed", color = colors_literacy, linewidth = 0.6) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(1, 5)) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = 1:5, labels = c("Very\nBad (1)", "Bad\n(2)", "Moderate\n(3)", "Good\n(4)", "Very\nGood (5)")) +
  labs(
    title = "All Participants: Health Literacy Scale",
    subtitle = "Dashed lines = 33rd and 67th percentiles",
    x = "Composite Score",
    y = "Density"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none")
```
